headline: Big Oil earnings show split in production strategy, shareholder returns
summary: HOUSTON/LONDON (Reuters) -Big Oil's first-quarter earnings have shown a clear split in how companies are positioned to weather the downturn sparked by a slump in oil prices to a four-year low in April.  Investors were focused on whether companies would cut share repurchases, since lower crude prices would leave them with less cash to fund the programs.  Buybacks and dividends are key to investor interest in the oil industry.

Buybacks and dividends are key to investor interest in the oil industry.

headline: Chevron Cuts Buybacks As Oil Plunges
summary: Chevron and Exxon reported high earnings even after Chevron said it would reduce it's share buybacks because of tumbling oil prices and a trade war. Meanwhile, Exxon is sticking with its's share buyback plans as it's earnings met analysts' estimates. Goldman Sachs Head of North American Natural Equity Research Neil Mehta has more on the story.

headline: Oil Falls as OPEC+ Weighs Another Major Production Increase
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Oil slumped as OPEC+ discussed making a second major production increase, inflaming concerns about swelling global supplies that have dragged down crude prices this year. headline: Chevron signals readiness to integrate Hess, downplays Exxon arbitration risk
summary: Investing.com -- After reporting solid Q1 results, Chevron Corp (NYSE:CVX) highlighted strategic progress across its operations while reaffirming confidence in its $53 billion acquisition of Hess Corporation (NYSE:HES). CEO Mike Wirth told Bloomberg Television the company is fully prepared to integrate Hess “very quickly” once it clears an arbitration case with Exxon Mobil Corp (NYSE:XOM), which claims a right of first refusal over Hess’s stake in Guyana’s massive oil field.

headline: Chevron CEO on Earnings, Energy Demand, Buying Hess
summary: Chevron Corp. Chief Executive Officer Mike Wirth says the oil and gas giant had a very strong quarter even though oil prices were flat. Wirth says the company is ramping up production in the Gulf of America and he expects to see great output. Wirth also says he's confident Chevron will be able to close the $53 billion deal to buy Hess Corp. He speaks to Bloomberg's Alix Steel.

headline: Exxon & Chevron earnings, energy challenges under Trump 2.0
summary: Exxon (XOM) and Chevron (CVX) posted earnings beats on Friday, but low oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) weigh on the industry. The Energy Word founder, Daniel Dicker, tells Morning Brief co-hosts Brad Smith and Madison Mills that the energy sector — including natural gas and sustainable options like solar — is uninvestable under Trump 2.0. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Chevron Will Reduce Stock Buybacks, and Shares are Dropping
summary: Chevron  stock fell early Friday even after the oil major reported earnings that beat expectations.  Investors appear to be more interested in its stock buybacks, which are expected to fall along with oil prices.  Chevron’s core results were relatively strong, and the company got a boost from the startup of a large project in Kazakhstan.

headline: Chevron Makes This Surprise Move In Guyana Contest With Exxon Mobil
summary: Exxon Mobil and Chevron reported better-than-expected first-quarter profit early Friday.  Exxon executives claimed, despite pressure on prices and margins, their "strategy remains unchanged."  Meanwhile, Chevron stressed shareholder value, returning nearly $7 billion to stockholders in Q1 but plans to reduce that amount in the second quarter.

headline: Chevron meets Wall Street profit estimates but cuts buybacks in Q2
summary: HOUSTON (Reuters) -Chevron on Friday reported first-quarter earnings that met Wall Street estimates, but said it would spend less on share repurchases in the current quarter, reflecting the shaky economic outlook faced by Big Oil.  The company's share repurchases this year could be between $11.5 billion and $13 billion, said Chevron Chief Financial Officer Eimear Bonner, which would be in the lower end of the company's guidance of $10 billion to $20 billion.  Shares of Chevron fell 2% in pre-market trading on Friday.

raw.headline: Chevron meets Wall Street profit estimates but cuts buybacks in Q2
raw.summary: HOUSTON (Reuters) -Chevron on Friday reported first-quarter earnings that met Wall Street estimates, but said it would spend less on share repurchases in the current quarter, reflecting the shaky economic outlook faced by Big Oil.  The company's share repurchases this year could be between $11.5 billion and $13 billion, said Chevron Chief Financial Officer Eimear Bonner, which would be in the lower end of the company's guidance of $10 billion to $20 billion.  Shares of Chevron fell 2% in pre-market trading on Friday.

headline: Chevron Reports First Quarter 2025 Results
summary: HOUSTON, May 02, 2025--Chevron Corporation (NYSE: CVX) reported earnings of $3.5 billion ($2.00 per share - diluted) for first quarter 2025, compared with $5.5 billion ($2.97 per share - diluted) in first quarter 2024. Included in the quarter was a net loss of $175 million related to legal reserves and a tax charge due to changes in the energy profits levy in the United Kingdom that were partially offset by the fair value measurement of Hess Corporation shares. Foreign currency effects decreased

Included in the quarter was a net loss of $175 million related to legal reserves and a tax charge due to changes in the energy profits levy in the United Kingdom that were partially offset by the fair value measurement of Hess Corporation shares.
